Yesterday's canyon du jour was Bruce. Most surreal!
Yesterday's highlight was Arches. Then drive west closer to Bryce.
Quick detour through Monument Valley and afternoon at Canyonland NP
Today we visited Canyon de Chelly. Pictures don't do it justice What a magnificent place! Geology + ruins
Moving on, this was Petrified Forest NP yesterday
Day 3 and 4 = Grand Canyon
Finally good enough Internet to post an update. That's day 2: Joshua Tree NP

Happy Canada Day to all our friends North of the Border!
Just Father/Son movie night at @saintanselms Rocky, 1976 version
Hurford: #Phobos orbital decay create stress that can fracture crust but interior needs to be weaker than surface #LPSC2016
Hurford: Grooves on #Phobos as 1st hint of disruption of satellites as its orbit decays #LPSC2016
Nathan Williams notes 1972 moonquake focus OK with chain of recent lobate scarps E of Mare Frigoris: Are these still active? #LPSC2016
Nathan Williams: Mare Frigoris is essentially the Man-on-the-Moon's unibrow. #LPSC2016
Byrne: if monoclines are analogue to lobate scarps, we have a lot of that on Earth! #LPSC2016
Paul Byrne advances East Kaibab monocline as #Earth analogue for wrinkle ridge #LPSC2016
@Ryan_N_Watkins @HOAshcroft Wouldn't be LPSC without hearing that a couple time :D
Cole: Reject 30° dip for wrinkle ridge plane so horizontal strain & decrease in planetary radius greater than previously thought. #LPSC2016
Cole: Ridge in Melas Chasma may resist erosion because of magmatic intrusion in wrinkle ridge fault plane #LPSC2016 #Mars
Cole: Dip of wrinkle ridge on #mars that continues in Valles Marineris wall is only 12°. #LPSC2016
@Geo_JackJack that was actually Sinan Özeren speaking, not Celâl Şengör
Nahm: Small scale graben are small scale. Highland terrain is in the highlands. I'm feeling in a rhyming mood. #LPSC2016
@DoctorApatite So, not worth running out between talks to grab a cup, right? #LPSC2016
Sinan Özeren: long Coprates-like troughs formed when no drainage, closed Hebes Chasma like troughs without drainage. #LPSC2016
Sinan Özeren: collapse driven by melting some ice underneath flour. Cohesion produces terraces #LPSC2016
Özeren: analogue experiments of #Mars dike intrusion using wheat flour because of relatively large cohesion. #LPSC2016
Özeren: As a mathematician, I have problems with the way elastic thickness is calculated. But talk is about tectonics, so... #LPSC2016
Brustel maps dikes on walls of Coprates Chasma, #Mars. See different orientation E vs. W of Coprates Rise #LPSC2016
Matt Weller uses estimates of #Mars mantle temperature to argue for episodic mobile lid in Northern hemisphere in Noachian #LPSC2016
Thiriet: If S. hemisphere crust of #Mars is more enriched than N. (due to Borealis impact), elastic thickness can differ by 60 km #LPSC2016
Andrews-Hanna argues No major impact on #Mars between Borealis/dichotomy and Hellas etc. impacts 400 Myr later. #LPSC2016
O'Neill: impacts can induce short-lived subduction, increase core heat flux in Hadean. #LPSC2016
Bethell: circumferential dike systems like around Lake Victoria analog to coronae (same scale, morphology, etc.) #LPSC2016
@planetpatman @amytoast Noticed that. "Venus found the fountain of Youth".
Treiman: Chlorapatite as the only ferroelectric rock-forming mineral to maybe 695±4K: good match for #Venus emissivity systematics #LPSC2016
When title doubles as conclusion slide: Venus radar-bright highlands: chloroapatite near the equator but not on Maxwell Montes #LPSC2016
@lynn_carter8 higher resolution orbital radar images of #Venus (with polarization) would be great. Hear! Hear! #LPSC2016
@lynn_carter8 describes detections of pyroclastic flows on #Venus using Radar polarimetry #LPSC2016
Smrekar: Did Venus find the fountain of youth ? #LPSC2016 (age revised to 200-150 Ma from earlier 300-1000 Ma estimates)
Gazel: Felsic rocks from Gale very different from Archean TTG. More likely fractional crystallization products —similar to Iceland #LPSC2016
Kruijer: Isotopes of martian meteorites imply magma ocean 20-40 Ma after CAI formation and second differentiation event at 60 Ma #LPSC2016
@Deschscoveries thermal evolution of #Charon would have 2 episodes of global ocean. Second ocean freezes 0.5 billion years ago. #LPSC2016
@Deschdiscoveries thermal evolution of #Charon would have 2 episodes of global ocean. Second freezes 0.5 billion years ago. #LPSC2016
Thanks @jtuttlekeane for the wonderful sketch. #LPSC2016 https://t.co/6Qw35LI3gf
Umurhan: ice flow can reflect basal topography, May explain what's seen on #Pluto but should disappear long-term. #LPSC2016
Jawin: irregular cones at Aristarchus would be largest pyroclastic cones on #Moon. Eruption later forms Schröter rille. #LPSC2016
Glacier on #Pluto looks lots like Earth, but no freeze-thaw cycle ( => no cirques), possible floating water ice blocks #LPSC2016
Paul Schenk asks to silence phones and screaming infants. #LPSC2016
#3Dglasses are coming out on the #Ceres #Pluto session at #LPSC2016 Get excited!
Ruesch: Ahuna Mons morphology is very consistent with volcanic domes, although not silicic, of course. Also <1Ga old. #LPSC2016 #Ceres
Common aspects of cryovolcanic(?) flows on Ceres: blueish color, preferential direction, and small H/L #LPSC2016
Le Corvec take home message: presenting at a conference one week before moving out of the country is a bad idea #LPSC2016 #WisdomWednesday
Goot love planetary volcanology at #LPSC2016 We went to Mars, Io, and Venus in less than an hour!
Shootout to @planetpatman Live tweeting paper link from #LPSC2016 podium! https://t.co/FPkDZmVpC8
@planetpatman compares shape of magma ascent criteria with University of Miami logo. Only at #LPSC2016 . Big volcano helps ascent.
@planetpatman at #LPSC2016 magma on Io have trouble getting to surface because of compression. vertical stress gradients to the rescue!
McKinnon + Spencer: Forward scattering shows smoother ice in center of proposed convection cells #Pluto #LPSC2016 https://t.co/Rb8Dj8EWHq
Game changer #Venus would be younger Earth's oceans! #LPSC2016 https://t.co/HfYXyEMoe2
@jtuttlekeane actually 3 talks for 1: now atmospheric sciences with Sputnik as cold trap, N2 deposition drives polar wander #LPSC2016
@jtuttlekeane adds tectonics to constraints on #Pluto polar wander. 2 talks for price of 1! Good match if polar wander + loading #LPSC2016
@jtuttlekeane takes on #Pluto polar wander. No sketching live, it seems. Great title "Pluto followed its heart" #LPSC2016
Wright Mons looks amazing in 3D (better on projection screen). Green line is Kelsey's laser pointer #LPSC2016 https://t.co/aLFToYJiBW
Nimmo: if no ocean, Sputnik mascon needs thin elastic crust, N2 thickness > 35km. If ocean, Te=60-80 km and N2 <5km thick. Better! #LPSC2016
Nimmo: Sputnik is along tidal axis of #Pluto likely because positive mass anomaly. Analog to mascon with ocean instead of mantle #LPSC2016
More 3D glass in Kelsey Singer's talk. Cthulhu Burney. high-res non-3D image has nice nested craters (subsurface layers) #LPSC2016
Is Paul Schenk keeping the best pictures for the end? Like a concert encore? #LPSC2016
Schenk: West Tombaugh regio consistent with large oblique impact. Based on scaling, ice would be no more than 6 km thick. #LPSC2016
Total relief on Pluto is 5km, Charon 18km. "not a surprise" dixit Paul Schenk. #LPSC2016
Craters in #Charon 's plains have pancake ejecta, same as Mars. #LPSC2016
Paul Schenk: I'm just going to show pretty pictures, that's all. #Pluto #LPSC2016
Paul Schenk speaking; time to put on 3D glasses #Pluto #LPSC2016
@tanyaofmars @Geo_JackJack That comes from a German town, so I'd follow the germans' way. Can we exhume ancient greeks for Io/Charon
@Geo_JackJack reminds of the old Eye-oh vs. hee-oh controversy (for Io). You could identify peoples academic affiliation with that one.
Random thought:heads-on impact simulations with strength look awfully like a snitch (from Harry Potter) #LPSC2016
I am really confused with the correct pronunciation of #Charon. heard from speakers at #LPSC2016 tcharon, karon, sharon
Davies transitions to impacts on #Pluto at #LPSC2016
Someone at #LPSC2016 is messing up with the light during talk on spectroscopy. Maybe they try to reproduce the blue slope of #Pluto tholins
Dalle Ore: explains clustering of spectra with a classification of noses in the audience. Only at #LPSC2016
Cook: #Pluto non-volatile composition is water with some small grain size and methanol. methanol anticorrelated with H2O and CH4. #LPSC2016
Just realized that @NASANewHorizons logo is an nonagon. I guess, #pluto is still 9th planet, dwarf or not (forgetting Ceres). #LPSC2016
Cruikshank: #Charon grey color made of carbonize tholin + H2O ice. Mordor macula still red because recently processed. #LPSC2016
Cruikshank: #Pluto ice tholin (short organic molecules) made from electron radiolysis of ice mixture N2+CH4+CO at 15K. #LPSC2016
Cruikshank: none of the ices on #Pluto and #Charon are colored, so red must be something else. #LPSC2016
Bowling: Occator models imply target has rock rheology. If ice, rim would not be steep enough. #LPSC2016 #Ceres
@Toy_Meister @NASA_Dawn that's right
Scully #Ceres 2 fracture sets, spacing correlates with crustal thickness. Also older than most craters #LPSC2016
Buczkowski: #Ceres tectonics: grooves, pit crater chains, fractures and troughs: intrusion at craters; ejecta blanket compaction #LPSC2016
Otto: polygonal craters on #Ceres density may correlate with topography, more near regional linear features (and aligned) #LPSC2016
Fejokoo: hexagonal crater on # ceres #LPSC2016 https://t.co/KCdijuJILc
Otto: polygonal craters. Start by reminding us that Barringer (Meteor) crater is not so simple! #LPSC2016
